business.headline: Why Ola, Uber and Rapido drivers are going on a 6-hour strike tomorrowThe strike has been called by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union, also known as TGPWU. The union represents app-based transport workers operating on platforms such as Ola, Uber and Rapido.

Gold jumps Rs 1,000, silver falls Rs 6,000: Should you buy now or wait longer?Recent swings in gold and silver prices have caught investors' attention, with the metals showing mixed trends after a strong run. The big question now is whether this is a pause before the next move — should you buy now or wait longer?

Is Budget 2026 putting services at the centre of India's growth strategy?Budget 2026, in essence, quietly recognises that India's economic growth and job creation are and will continue to be powered by services – both tradable and non-tradable, while maintaining the focus on infrastructure and manufacturing.

Can RBI's new measures make it easier to do business and boost credit flow?With the RBI announcing new steps to improve credit access and ease regulations, attention is turning to their real-world impact. Could these changes help businesses grow and borrow more smoothly?

Why stock markets fell after RBI kept key lending rates unchanged Even though inflation is within the comfort band and growth remains robust, RBI signalled that it is not ready to shift toward a softer stance. Global uncertainties, from geopolitical tensions to commodity volatility, continue to influence the outlook.

RBI keeps repo rate unchanged, why its still a win-win situation for homebuyersWhile many homebuyers were hoping for a rate cut, the RBI decision to keep rates steady at 5.25% is not bad news, especially for those who value stability and clear planning.

RBI maintains 5.25% repo rate: What it means for homebuyers and EMIsThe RBI has decided to keep its key interest rate unchanged in its latest policy review. What could this steady stance mean for homebuyers and their monthly loan repayments?

RBI keeps key lending rates unchanged at 5.25% in last MPC of FY26The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept repo rate unchanged at 5.25% in the last meeting for Fy26. The RBI Governor said inflation trends have been supportive of keeping rates unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks continue fall; TCS, TechM down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 216.98 points to 83,097.00, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 80.25 points to 25,562.55 as of 9:48 am.

Bitcoin prices hit 16-month low: Will it fall below $60,000?Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, dropped to an intraday low of $60,008.52 during volatile trade. This was the weakest level seen since October 2024

RBI MPC announcement today: Will Governor Sanjay Malhotra reduce repo rate?In its December policy meeting, the Reserve Bank of India had reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points from 5.50% to 5.25%. At the same time, it retained a neutral policy stance.

India-EU trade deal and the gender blind spot in India's trade policyIntegrating gender considerations into trade policy design, implementation, and evaluation is therefore essential—not only to ensure that trade works for women, but to ensure that trade works better overall.

India–Nigeria ties key to shaping a stronger global southBy working closely through diplomatic engagement, trade and cultural cooperation, Musawa believes that both nations can play a leading role in shaping a future where developing countries have a louder voice on the world stage.

Peace, partnerships and progress top agenda for Caribbean nationsSpeaking to India Today at the World Governments Summit, Wheatley and Mitchell highlighted the importance of peace, economic diversification and stronger global partnerships for Caribbean nations.

Bitcoin hovers around $71,000, hits weakest level in about 15 monthsBitcoin fell nearly 2% to around $71,000 on February 5, marking its weakest level in about 15 months. The world's largest cryptocurrency has now lost more than 42% from its October peak of $126,000 last year.

Global conflicts expose decline of international law, says Timor-Leste president President of Timor-Leste José Ramos-Horta said the world is witnessing the steady breakdown of global systems that were created to protect peace, human rights, and fair international trade.

India, Gulf Cooperation Council agree to restart talks on long-pending free trade dealThe move formally revives negotiations between India and the six-nation bloc after a long gap and signals a renewed push to deepen economic cooperation.
Sensex ends 504 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; Eternal down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 503.76 points to close at 83,313.93, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 133.20 points to end at 25,642.80.

Sensex down 500 points: Why is stock market falling today?At 2:30 PM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 569.43 points at 83,248.26. The NSE Nifty50 also declined, falling 164.50 points to 25,611.50. Both benchmark indices were down by over half a percent, showing clear pressure across the market.

AI and policy are redefining digital lifestyles, say global tech leadersAl Shamsi said telecom companies are no longer just service providers focused on speed and coverage. They are evolving into broader technology platforms that support consumer, enterprise and government services.

entertainment.headline: Pankaj Tripathi returns to theatre after 12 years, shares stage with daughter Aashi Pankaj Tripathi is set to make his stage comeback after a 12-year hiatus with the musical comedy play Lailaaj. The production will feature Tripathi in a cameo alongside his daughter Aashi.

Talwiinder says his world changed after viral video with Disha Patani A leaked video forced Talwiinder into the spotlight he always avoided. His emotional reaction reveals how the moment changed everything overnight.

Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain! Fun on the Run review: Known faces, familiar laughsRelease Date:Thu Feb 06, 2025 Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain! Fun on the Run is a breezy extension of the popular sitcom, preserving its signature humour for loyal fans. While the horror-comedy twist feels unnecessary, solid performances from the lead cast and Ravi Kishan ensure a light-hearted, entertaining experience.

The Lincoln Lawyer Season 4 review: Putting its star lawyer on trial, and winningRelease Date:Thu Feb 05, 2026 The Lincoln Lawyer Season 4 raises the stakes by putting Mickey Haller in the witness box. Accused of murder, the defence attorney is forced to fight for himself while confronting emotional and procedural dead ends.

A badly managed zoo: Did Suyyash Rai take a dig at The 50 in cryptic post Actor Suyyash Rai took a veiled dig at the reality show The 50, calling it a badly managed zoo. His close friend Prince Narula and his wife Yuvika are also a part of the show.

Bloodied fist, bold warning: Anil Kapoor's Subedaar first look poster out The makers have unveiled the first-look poster for Subedaar, featuring Anil Kapoor as Subedaar Arjun Maurya. The new project signals the veteran actor's entry into a high-stakes action drama.

Vadh 2: Sanjay Mishra, Neena Gupta urge fans to keep spoilers under wraps As Vadh 2, starring Sanjay Mishra and Neena Gupta, releases in theatres, the lead actors urge viewers not to disclose key plot twists or the climax. In their respective social media posts, the two spoke about preserving the film's thriller experience.

Sanam Teri Kasam 2 is officially happening, confirms producer Producer Deepak Mukut shared an update on Sanam Teri Kasam reboot as the film completed ten years. The 2016 film featured Harshvardhan Rane and Mawra Hocane in lead roles.

Manoj Bajpayee on Ghooskhor Pandat title row: This was never about a community Amid the backlash over the Ghooskhor Pandat title, actor Manoj Bajpayee issued a statement emphasising respect for public sentiment, and explained that his role was rooted in character and storytelling rather than commentary on any community.

Zayn Malik's Konnakol tour announced, India not part of the list British pop star Zayn Malik has announced his fifth studio album, Konnakol, with a release date of April 17. The tour excludes India despite strong South Asian musical influences, sparking disappointment among fans.

Aditi Rao Hydari, Barun Sobti to lead Konkona Sen Sharma's 1st web series: Report Konkona Sen Sharma is directing her first long-form digital comedy series starring Aditi Rao Hydari and Barun Sobti. The contemporary romantic comedy is set in South Delhi and is expected to premiere by late 2026.

Vadh 2 review: Sanjay Mishra, Neena Gupta try hard to elevate a tame thrillerRelease Date:Fri Feb 06, 2026 Vadh 2 benefits from its prison setting and dependable performances, but a familiar plot and uneven storytelling prevent it from delivering the tension it promises.

Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2 on OTT: When and where to watch Kapil Sharma's film Kapil Sharma's comedy sequel Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2 is now available for streaming on OTT, giving audiences another chance to watch the film at home. The film's OTT premiere follows a lukewarm box office response due to stiff competition from Dhurandhar.

Margot Robbie honours Emily Bronte with mourning bracelet at London premiere Margot Robbie's London premiere look carried a hidden meaning tied to Wuthering Heights. The detail behind her jewellery has everyone talking.

Manoj Bajpayee replaces Govinda in Bhagam Bhag 2: Report Bhagam Bhag 2 is set to revive the cult comedy franchise with a fresh cast and storyline. Manoj Bajpayee replaces Govinda, promising new chaos and laughs for fans.

BLACKPINK's Lisa to lead Notting Hill-inspired rom-com in Hollywood debut Lisa of BLACKPINK is set to star in a new Netflix romantic comedy inspired by Notting Hill. The film marks her first solo lead role in an English-language movie and a significant step in her acting career.

Vishal Jethwa joins Shakti Shalini opposite Aneet Padda: Sources Vishal Jethwa has signed on to star opposite Aneet Padda in the upcoming film Shakti Shalini. The female-led action drama is set to begin shooting in March and promises a blend of powerful storytelling and intense action.

Yogi Adityanath orders FIR against film Ghooskhor Pandat, Manoj Bajpayee reacts Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered an FIR against the director and team of the upcoming Netflix film Ghooskhor Pandat, citing concerns about social harmony. Manoj Bajpayee has issued a clarification on his X account.

Nick Jonas says marrying Priyanka Chopra tops his advice to younger self Nick Jonas shares the one thing he'd tell his younger self and it involves Priyanka Chopra. His emotional reflections reveal how much life has changed since.

general news.headline: IND vs ENG final Live: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's carnage comes to an end at 175India (IND) vs England (ENG) Live Score, U19 World Cup final: IND (251/3 in 25.3 ov), Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's historic knock has finally come to an end. India will now look to rebuild and ensure that they can keep the momentum going.

Delhi Police denies surge in missing girls, BJP alleges paid campaign to push filmDelhi Police has dismissed viral claims of a surge in missing girls, alleging paid promotion behind the panic after reports claimed a massive surge in missing people cases in the national capital in January.

Every home has a patient: Diarrhoea, boils linked to contaminated water in Noida sectorIn Noida's Sector 29, a residential society home to retired Army veterans, residents now measure daily life in sediments and insects flowing from their taps. Days without safe water have become routine, with little sign of urgency in fixing the crisis. You should read this ground report to understand how easily a water contamination emergency can take hold, and why no neighbourhood is immune.

Delhi man falls to death in open Jal Board pit, 3 officials suspendedA young man from Delhi's Rohini went missing during his return home, leading to a frantic overnight search by his family and police. He was found dead in an uncovered water board pothole in Janakpuri. The Delhi Jal Board has suspended three officials following an initial probe.

Internet spots Hamza in Balochistan: BLA attack clip has shades of DhurandharHandcrafted ByOur Editors When Baloch fighters went out to launch decades' deadliest attack on Pakistan, the visuals looked straight out of Dhurandhar. The visual was uncanny: wind-swept desert, militant gear, flowing beard, unhurried swagger, eyes fixed forward, making the internet believe 'Balochistan has its own Hamza Ali Mazari.'

Yogi Adityanath orders FIR against film Ghooskhor Pandat, Manoj Bajpayee reactsUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered an FIR against the director and team of the upcoming Netflix film Ghooskhor Pandat, citing concerns about social harmony. Manoj Bajpayee has issued a clarification on his X account.

Will shake Delhi: Lashkar's open warning blows lid off Pakistan's terror nexusWhat is of particular concern is that the open call for terrorism by the Lashkar terrorist was delivered not from hiding or behind the camera, but from a public platform in Lahore.

What is the Pir Panjal controversy that has rocked Jammu and Kashmir AssemblyPir Panjal row: BJP leader Sunil Sharma has stirred a hornet's nest by claiming that there is no such region as Pir Panjal in Jammu and Kashmir. Why has it triggered a controversy? Why has it become an emotive issue in J&K?

As Mao marched, India won Tawang without firing even a shot. Thanks to Bob KhatingIn the eastern Himalayas, Tawang used to be a loosely administered frontier region even after the 1914 Shimla Convention placed it in the British-Indian territory. Mao Zedong's annexation of Tibet in 1950 rang alarm bells for India. Then, Major Bob Khathing Ralengnao, a Manipuri Naga officer, achieved what the British could not. He hoisted the Indian Tricolour in Tawang on February 14, 1951, and integrated it with India, without firing a single shot.

Ex-mayor in UK speaks in Urdu, asks rape-accused son to hide sex-assault videoNaheed Ejaz, a Pakistani-origin former mayor of a UK borough, tried to help her rape-accused son, instructing him in Urdu so that cops didn't follow what she was telling him. Ejaz, of Bracknell Forest, was telling her son to hide the mobile that had the video of the sex assault of a 15-year-old girl. She has also been charged now.

Pak plays cricket politics, drops it for dollars from India-born World Bank headPakistan has decided to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India. However, on the other hand, it has rolled out the red carpet for Indian-origin World Bank chief Ajay Banga. Pakistan's mehman nawazi for Banga was not for nothing. We explain the reasons behind it.

Harshit Rana ruled out of T20 World Cup due to injury: SourcesIndia pacer Harshit Rana has reportedly been ruled out of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup after picking up an injury during a warm-up match against South Africa in Navi Mumbai on Wednesday.

Basant makes a stunning return to Pak's Lahore after a two-decade banAfter a 19-year ban, Basant festivities have returned to Lahore and set the city abuzz. Rooftops in the Pakistani city have come alive again with DJ music and hotels in Androon Lahore are fully booked. The Lahore sky is crowded with kites as the Maryam Nawaz government allowed three-day celebrations and promoted the festival.
Bird flu is back—Here's why you should careFresh deaths of birds in Chennai reignite fears over a fast-evolving virus that has a very high fatality rate.

Vaibhav Sooryavanshi scripts history, hits fastest U19 World Cup final hundredVaibhav Sooryavanshi scripted history in the U19 World Cup by hitting the fastest hundred in the final of the tournament. Vaibhav Sooryavanshi reached his century in 55 balls.

Are ski-jumpers enhancing penis-size to fly further in Winter Olympics?A major controversy has brewed in the Winter Olympics. WADA is looking into allegations that ski jumpers are temporarily enhancing their penis sizes to fly further in their events.

India once rejected this Balochistan port. China controls it todayGwadar port in Pakistan's Balochistan is at the centre of unrest, geopolitics and Chinese influence. Once ruled by Oman and later offered to India, this strategic coastal town is now operated by China for decades, raising questions about sovereignty, local anger and South Asia's missed geopolitical turns.

H5N1 outbreak in Chennai, hundreds of crows found dead; government issues advisoryHundreds of crows have been found dead across Chennai, with subsequent laboratory tests confirming the presence of the H5N1 avian influenza virus.

Caught on CCTV: Punjab AAP leader shot dead outside gurdwara in broad daylightAAP leader Lucky Oberoi was shot multiple times outside a Gurdwara Sahib in Jalandhar's Model Town by two bike-borne men. He was rushed to a hospital where doctors declared him brought dead.

Top Russian general shot multiple times in Moscow in alleged assassination attemptA senior Russian military intelligence official, Lieutenant General Vladimir Alekseev, was shot multiple times in Moscow in an alleged assassination attempt.

MP university grows potatoes in the air: How is it possible?This soilless technique promises virus-free, high-quality seed potatoes, addressing key challenges in traditional farming amid India's growing food security needs.

Why Ola, Uber and Rapido drivers are going on a 6-hour strike tomorrowThe strike has been called by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union, also known as TGPWU. The union represents app-based transport workers operating on platforms such as Ola, Uber and Rapido.

Madras High Court upholds Rs 1.5 crore tax penalty on actor-politician VijayThe Madras High Court has upheld a Rs 1.5 crore penalty on actor-turned-politician Vijay for alleged undisclosed income of Rs 15 crore during 2015-16. The court ruled the Income Tax Department's notice was issued within the prescribed time limit, allowing the penalty to stand.

China reveals space aircraft carrier. Superweapon or propaganda?China has unveiled a concept for a flying aircraft carrier that would hover at the edge of space. The idea suggests it could launch unmanned jets and hypersonic missiles. Many are calling it propaganda. Even if the flying aircraft carrier comes to life, it will take Beijing at least three decades to build it.

sports.headline: Bangladesh our brothers, hope they support us in T20 World Cup: Pakistan captain Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha on Thursday referred to Bangladesh as Pakistan's "brothers" and expressed hope that Bangladeshi fans would continue to back the Men in Green at the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

Harshit Rana ruled out of T20 World Cup due to injury: Sources India pacer Harshit Rana has reportedly been ruled out of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup after picking up an injury during a warm-up match against South Africa in Navi Mumbai on Wednesday.

Despite criticism of ICC, Nasser Hussain named in T20 World Cup commentary panel Former England captain Nasser Hussain has been named in the ICC's T20 World Cup 2026 commentary panel despite recently criticising the global body over governance, consistency and the treatment of Bangladesh and Pakistan.

Are ski-jumpers enhancing penis-size to fly further in Winter Olympics? A major controversy has brewed in the Winter Olympics. WADA is looking into allegations that ski jumpers are temporarily enhancing their penis sizes to fly further in their events.

India will now look to rebuild and ensure that they can keep the momentum going.

Australia hit by injury crisis, after Cummins, Hazlewood ruled out of T20 WC Australia are in a major injury crisis right ahead of the T20 World Cup. After the exit of Pat Cummins, fast bowler Josh Hazlewood has been ruled out of the tournament.

Mandhana reveals how RCB took the Kohli way en route to title no.2 in WPL RCB captain Smriti Mandhana revealed that the one key thing that helped the side to their second WPL trophy. Mandhana in her post-match address, revealed that RCB had put a lot of work behind the scenes.

Heartbreak is their canvas: Delhi Capitals paint pain like Picasso in WPL history WPL 2026: Delhi Capitals lost to Royal Challengers Bengaluru by six wickets in the WPL final on Thursday at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara. Jemimah Rodrigues-led DC became the first team in the tournament's history to win the Eliminator but fell short of lifting the WPL title.

Virat Kohli writes special message to Smriti Mandhana after RCB's 2nd WPL title WPL: Royal Challengers Bengaluru became the first ever team in the history to hold the IPL and WPL titles together. After the historic feat, Virat Kohli penned a special message for RCB women's team captain Smriti Mandhana to congratulate the team.

U19 World Cup final: India eye record-extending 6th title, favourites vs England U19 World Cup: India and England are set to lock horns in the grand finale on Friday, February 6. In the semi-final on Wednesday, India beat Afghanistan by seven wickets with a record run-chase in the tournament's history.

Yuzi Chahal tired of endless social media rumours: I know who I really amYuzvendra Chahal opens up on social media rumours, online trolling and fan wars, saying he ignores the noise and trusts his family and close friends.

Smriti Mandhana has gone through a lot, this win is for her: Shreyanka PatilWPL 2026 final: Shreyanka Patil dedicated RCB's historic second WPL title victory to Smriti Mandhana for leading the side once again after the personal setbacks she faced before the tournament.

RCB script historic chase to clinch 2nd title as DC stumble again in finalRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) scripted history by chasing down the highest total in WPL to clinch their second title. Smriti Mandhana led from the front with her innings of 87 (41) as RCB chased down 204 in 19.4 overs to beat Delhi Capitals by six wickets in the final.

Sri Lanka urges Pakistan to reconsider India boycott, flags heavy losses: ReportT20 World Cup 2026: Sri Lanka Cricket has reportedly urged the PCB to reconsider boycotting the India match, warning of heavy financial and tourism losses, with the marquee fixture at risk of being called off.

India can only lose T20 World Cup on it's own, no team can beat them: Yuzvendra ChahalIndia spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has said that India are firm favourites to win the T20 World Cup 2026 and that only their own mistakes could lead to them losing in the tournament. India will begin their campaign against the USA on February 7 at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

Gautam Gambhir has changed team's milestone-obsessed mindset: Suryakumar YadavIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav praised head coach Gautam Gambhir for prioritising team goals over personal milestones. The India captain sakid that the shift has fuelled India's dominant run in T20 cricket and boosted team unity.

India ready to play Pakistan in T20 World Cup, will travel to Colombo: SuryakumarT20 World Cup 2026: India captain Suryakumar Yadav said the Men in Blue will travel to Colombo for the February 15 match, despite Pakistan threatening a boycott. Suryakumar said the matter is beyond his control, adding that even the International Cricket Council finds it difficult to intervene when decisions are driven by the Pakistan government.

Pak will make a U-turn on India boycott stance after February 12: Chetan SharmaFormer India pacer Chetan Sharma expects Pakistan to reverse their boycott of the India match after the Bangladesh elections. The Pakistan government have denied permission to their cricket team to play against India.

Mustafizur heads to PSL after shock IPL exit, to earn 77 per cent lessMustafizur Rahman has signed with Lahore Qalandars for PSL 11 after his IPL release by KKR, agreeing to a deal worth about Rs 2 crore, nearly 77 per cent lower than his IPL contract.

Sunil Gavaskar backs Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for 2027 ODI World CupSunil Gavaskar did not think twice when he backed both Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to play the 2027 ODI World Cup. Speaking at India Today's Salaam Cricket 2026, Gavaskar backed the idea of having India's favourite duo for one last push for the ODI crown. "Virat and Kohli will definitely play ODI World Cup 2027. They've been performing well. Even if the ODI are six months later, they will continue practising and stay in touch with the game. Their experience is of utmost importance to the team," he said.

Dancing with joy: Gavaskar's promise to Suryakumar Yadav if India defend T20 crownSunil Gavaskar has promised India captain Suryakumar Yadav a joyful dance if the team successfully defend their T20 World Cup crown, saying nothing moves him more than seeing India lift a trophy.

WPL Final Highlights: Royal Challengers Bengaluru win 2nd title in dramatic fashionWPL 2026, Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB-W) vs Delhi Capitals (DC-W) Live Score: The Royal Challengers Bengaluru have done it again, leaving Delhi Capitals in the dust to win their second Women's Premier League title.

Will Pakistan play India in T20 World Cup semi final or final? Captain revealsPakistan captain Salman Agha has said that they will have to seek the government's permission to face India in the semi-final or final of the T20 World Cup 2026. Pakistan government has denied permission to its players to play against India in the group stage game.

Anurag Thakur gets relief as Supreme Court lifts nine-year BCCI banThe Supreme Court has lifted the nine-year ban on Anurag Thakur, allowing him to participate in BCCI affairs after noting the ban was not meant to be lifelong and citing his unconditional apology.

Uncertainty over India vs Pakistan match not good for players: Ishant SharmaFormer India bowler Ishant Sharma has expressed concern for players amid the uncertainty of the India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match. The ongoing boycott threat by Pakistan could impact players' preparations and tournament dynamics.

Be the same person no matter what happens: Rishabh Pant reveals Rahul Dravid's advicePant, who flourished under Dravid across formats, said one piece of advice from the Indian legend has stayed with him.

"I think the key is not thinking about it too much and not dwelling on it. There's one really good line I learnt from Rahul (Dravid) bhai. He always told me one thing: 'Rishabh, no matter what happens, try to be the same person when you score a hundred and when you score a zero,'" Pant said.

"I think, as an athlete, that's the hardest thing to do — to remain who you are. Emotions sometimes get the better of you, but that line always stays with me. So personally, I try that. Whether I score zero or a hundred, I want to be the same guy. Maybe when I get out, it hurts more. I don't enjoy scoring runs as much as I feel the pain of getting out," the wicketkeeper-batter concluded.

Suryakumar Yadav breaks silence on Pakistan boycott threat: We are ready to playT20 World Cup: India's T20I captain, Suryakumar Yadav, remained firm that their plans do not change considering Pakistan's boycott of their group-stage clash. He said that they would prepare for the game regardless of Pakistan's stance.

Dravid's student, now Abhishek's fan: Rishabh Pant on batting mavericksRishabh Pant has revealed his admiration for two batting mavericks - Rahul Dravid and Abhishek Sharma. Speaking on India Today's Salaam Cricket, Pant revealed how one of Dravid's advises will stay with him lifelong.

Salaam Cricket Highlights: India favourites, says Gavaskar. Wasan disagreesSalaam Cricket 2026, T20 World Cup Highlights: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar led a star-studded list of cricketers who spoke about Indian cricket and the upcoming T20 World Cup. Most of them said India are the firm favourites to defend the crown, but former bowler Atul Wasan backed New Zealand to win big.

Thank you, Pakistan: Bangladesh reveals big cricket nexus against IndiaBangladesh's sports adviser Asif Nazrul thanked Pakistan for backing Dhaka's boycott of the T20 World Cup, after Islamabad decided to skip its match against India in Colombo. A day earlier, Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif publicly justified the move as standing "completely" with Bangladesh. This exposed how both governments made cricket a theatre of a political engagement against India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
